_prev_prog_3.Description: United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, KS uses the recommended matrix approach to preventing accidental releases at the site.  The site stores 11,200 gallons  anhydrous ammonia in a portable trailer.  This ammonia storage is used to supply ammonia to a portable pipe reactor operation, on a periodic basis.  Salina's prevention program is directed toward the operation of setting up the portable ammonia trailer, filling the trailer, and securing the trailer after reactor operations are complete.  Salina performs visual inspections plus standard operating methods for hooking up and transporting the portable trailer.  During reactor operations, the prevention program is governed by PSM compliance requirements associated with portablepipe reactor.  The RMP for the Salina site meshes with PSM requirements of the portable pipe reactor to provide the appropriate regulatory covereage.  In addition to above policies, industry standard equipment inspections and testing ensure the continued viability of the ammonia trailer.  Close contact is maintained with the LEPC and other local agencies.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, KS operation is committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually improving both practices and measures to prevent the release of regulated substances.  In the event of a release, the Salina facility is prepared to work with the Saline County LEPC and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact to people and the environment.

The Salina facility's primary activity is the storage and blending of fertilizers for wholesale purposes.  These activities include storage of anhydrous ammonia.  This activity involves receiving an ammonia trailer that is disconnected from the truck.  The ammonia trailer is staged for use by a contract portable pipe reactor.  The portable pipe reactor comes on site to react ammonia with phosphoric acid to produce an ammonium polyphosphate liquid fertilizer.   The reactor operation is contracted with others and covered by a separate PSM (owned by the contract organization).  The operation and maintenance procedures for the portable reactor operation reside with the contract organization.  The Emergency Response Procedures for the Salina site and contracted organization are integrated into one response, prior to operation of the portable reactor.

United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, KS has taken the necessary steps to comply with accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  The following briefly describes the prevention program elements in place at this stationary source:

Process Safety Information:  The facility maintains information describing the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with the covered process.

Process Hazard Analysis:  Studies are conducted to ensure the hazards associated with process operations are identified, understood and controlled.

Operating Procedures:  Written operating procedures are maintained for covered process operations.  These procedure

s address the following activities:   initial startup, normal, temporary, emergency shutdown, normal shutdown and startup following a turnaround.

Training:  A program is in place to ensure employee(s) are knowledgeable and trained in procedures associated with the covered processes.

Mechanical Integrity:  Covered process equipment is maintained consistent with generally accepted engineering practices.  Covered process equipment is routinely inspected and tested.  Maintenance activites are conducted by qualified personnel.  Deficiencies are corrected in a timely manner.

Management of Change:  Written procedures are in place to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and/or procedures.  Affected personnel are informed and trained to deal with authorized system changes.

Pre-Startup Review:  Technical and operational reviews will be conducted on new processes and/or modifications to existing covered processes.  Reviews confirm the construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable.  Reviews are completed prior to placing equipment in operation.

Compliance Audits:  Internal audits are conducted on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions specified under the RMP rule are being implemented.  At a minimum, these audits are conducted every three (3) years.  Any determined corrective actions are completed in a timely manner.

Incident Investigations:  Investigations are conducted to determine the root cause of covered process incidents.  In addition to determination and correction, investigations are directed toward preventing reoccurence.  Investigations become process safety information and are retained for five (5) years.

Employee Participation:  United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, KS employee(s) actively contribute in the following:  process hazard assessments, operating procedure development, maintenance procedure development, training development and implementation, pre-startup reviews, incident investigations, an

d compliance audtis.  Additionally, employee(s) have access to all information pertaining to the facility's RMP.

Contractors:  Periodically, Salina may hire contractors to conduct specialized operational, maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to work, contractors are trained on the covered processes, relevant process safety information and emergency response actions.

Five (5) Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five (5) years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage.  Nor to our knowledge, has there been any releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage and/or environmental damage.

Emergency Action Plan:  United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, KS has a written emergency action plan.  This plan includes notification of the Saline County LEPC.  Local authorities have been provided with emergency planning and community right-to-know information.

Planned changes to improve safety:  United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, KS  views safety improvement as a continual process.  Periodic evaluations (both internal and external) are performed to assess the facility status.  At this time, and aside from sustaining maintenance activities, there are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding anhydrous ammonia.
